required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of BOTOX® as Headache Prophylaxis for Chronic Migraine
clinical_study.official_title: A 24-month, Prospective, Non-interventional Study to Describe the Long Term, Real-Life Use of BOTOX® for the Symptomatic Treatment of Adults With Chronic Migraine, Measuring Healthcare Resource Utilization, and Patient Reported Outcomes Observed in Practice

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational study to describe the long term use of Onabotulinumtoxin A (BOTOX®) as prescribed by the physician for headache prophylaxis in adults with chronic migraine. All treatment decisions lie with the physician.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Admitted to the Hospital for Headache
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (previous 3 months prior to first dose of BOTOX®) and Last Follow-up Visit (FU last) [median 21.20 months]
primary_outcome.description: The Baseline value included participants who had been admitted to the hospital for headache in the last 3 months prior to the baseline visit (first administration of BOTOX®); the Last Follow-up value included participants who been admitted to the hospital for headache since the previous visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Days of Headache-related Hospital Admissions
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (previous 3 months prior to first dose of BOTOX@) to FU last [median 21.20 months]
primary_outcome.description: The number of admission days is presented as the mean, normalized to a period of 90 days. The Baseline value included admissions during the last 3 months prior to the baseline visit (first administration of BOTOX®); the Last Follow-up value included admissions since the second-to-last visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Visited Any Healthcare Professional (HCP)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (previous 3 months prior to first dose of BOTOX®) to FU last [median 21.20 months]
primary_outcome.description: The Baseline value included participants who had visited an HCP in the last 3 months prior to the baseline visit (first administration of Botox); the value for FU last included participants who visited an HCP since the second-to-last visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Migraine-Specific Quality of Life Questionnaire (MSQ) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Last Administration of BOTOX® (ADM last) [median 20.30 months]
secondary_outcome.description: The MSQ is a 14-item questionnaire to measure health-related quality-of-life attributed to migraine in the past 4 weeks. Each item is scored on a 6-point scale where: 1=none of the time to 6=all of the time. There are 3 dimensions: Role-function Restrictive (questions 1 to 7; score range 7 to 42), Role-function Preventive (questions 8 to 11; score range 4 to 24) and Emotional-function (questions 12 to 14; score range 3 to 18). The individual dimension scores were converted to a score of 0 to 100; the total score ranged from 0 to 300 with higher numbers representing a better quality of life. A positive change from baseline in the dimension scores and the total score indicates that quality of life has improved.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the EQ-5D Questionnaire Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (prior to first dose of BOTOX®) to ADM last [median 20.30 months]
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D consists of 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression) assessed by the participant using a 3-point scale: 1=no problems, 2=some problems and 3=extreme problems. The combination of levels from the 5 dimensions results in a health state code. The total score is calculated by converting the health state code into a score: start with score 1.000=[11111] (perfect health state), subtract 0.081 (constant) for any other state, subtract nothing for level 1 on any dimension, subtract appropriate level 2 or level 3 value for each dimension from a table of constants [Level 2: Mobility 0.069, Self-care 0.104, Usual activity 0.036, Pain/discomfort 0.123, Anxiety/depression 0.071] [Level 3: Mobility 0.314, Self-care 0.214, Usual activity 0.094, Pain/discomfort 0.386, Anxiety/depression 0.236], subtract 0.269 if any dimension has a level 3 problem. Higher numbers indicate better health. A positive change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Health State Score of the EQ-5D Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (prior to first dose of BOTOX®) to ADM last [median 20.30 months]
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D health state scale is a visual analog scale that ranges from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state), with higher scores indicating a better state of health. Participants were asked to rate their health state on a drawn line that started at 0 and ended at 100. A positive change from baseline in the health state score indicates that the participant's health state has improved.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Number of Headache Days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (prior to first dose of BOTOX®) to ADM last [median 20.30 months]
secondary_outcome.description: At each visit, participants were asked to provide the number of headache days he/she experienced in the last month. A headache day was defined as 4 or more hours of continuous headache. A negative change from Baseline (less headache days) indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Good or Very Good Responses on the 4-Point Treatment Satisfaction Scale
secondary_outcome.description: At each visit, participants and physicians were asked to indicate the level of satisfaction that he/she had with the treatment. Physicians indicated the level of satisfaction with the patient's treatment. The 4- point scale consisted of the following responses: insufficient, moderate, good and very good. The combined percentage of "good" and "very good" responses by participants and physicians are reported.

arm_group.description: BOTOX® (botulinum toxin Type A) administered according to physician prescription for the treatment of chronic migraine; all treatment decisions lie with the physician.

intervention.description: Botulinum toxin Type A (BOTOX®) administered according to physician prescription.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with chronic migraine prescribed BOTOX® for the prophylaxis of headaches

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Prescribed BOTOX® for the prophylaxis of headaches.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Received treatment with any botulinum toxin Type A serotype in the last 26 weeks
- Current participation in Allergan's Botox Chronic Migraine Post-Authorisation Safety Study (protocol 191622-110).

facility.name: Klinikum der Universität München - Großhadern, Neurologische Klinik
Istituto Neurologico Carlo Besta di Milano
LLC Center for Interdisciplinary Dentistry and Neurology
Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Victoria
Spire Hull and East Riding Hospital
University Hospital of North Staffordshire, Neurology Research Unit

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Thinks Injections Take Too Much Time
Trying to get Pregnant or Nursing

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Migraine-Specific Quality of Life Questionnaire (MSQ) Score
outcome.description: The MSQ is a 14-item questionnaire to measure health-related quality-of-life attributed to migraine in the past 4 weeks. Each item is scored on a 6-point scale where: 1=none of the time to 6=all of the time. There are 3 dimensions: Role-function Restrictive (questions 1 to 7; score range 7 to 42), Role-function Preventive (questions 8 to 11; score range 4 to 24) and Emotional-function (questions 12 to 14; score range 3 to 18). The individual dimension scores were converted to a score of 0 to 100; the total score ranged from 0 to 300 with higher numbers representing a better quality of life. A positive change from baseline in the dimension scores and the total score indicates that quality of life has improved.

outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set, all participants who received at least one dose of BOTOX®, with data available for analysis at the given time-point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the EQ-5D Questionnaire Total Score
outcome.description: The EQ-5D consists of 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression) assessed by the participant using a 3-point scale: 1=no problems, 2=some problems and 3=extreme problems. The combination of levels from the 5 dimensions results in a health state code. The total score is calculated by converting the health state code into a score: start with score 1.000=[11111] (perfect health state), subtract 0.081 (constant) for any other state, subtract nothing for level 1 on any dimension, subtract appropriate level 2 or level 3 value for each dimension from a table of constants [Level 2: Mobility 0.069, Self-care 0.104, Usual activity 0.036, Pain/discomfort 0.123, Anxiety/depression 0.071] [Level 3: Mobility 0.314, Self-care 0.214, Usual activity 0.094, Pain/discomfort 0.386, Anxiety/depression 0.236], subtract 0.269 if any dimension has a level 3 problem. Higher numbers indicate better health. A positive change from Baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (prior to first dose of BOTOX®) to ADM last [median 20.30 months]
outcome.population: Participant from the Safety Analysis Set, all participants who received at least one dose of BOTOX®, with data available at the given time-point.

measure.description: The EQ-5D consists of 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression) assessed by the participant using a 3-point scale: 1=no problems, 2=some problems and 3=extreme problems. The combination of levels from the 5 dimensions results in a health state code. The total score is calculated by converting the health state code into a score: start with score 1.000=[11111] (perfect health state), subtract 0.081 (constant) for any other state, subtract nothing for level 1 on any dimension, subtract appropriate level 2 or level 3 value for each dimension from a table of constants [Level 2: Mobility 0.069, Self-care 0.104, Usual activity 0.036, Pain/discomfort 0.123, Anxiety/depression 0.071] [Level 3: Mobility 0.314, Self-care 0.214, Usual activity 0.094, Pain/discomfort 0.386, Anxiety/depression 0.236], subtract 0.269 if any dimension has a level 3 problem. Higher numbers indicate better health. A positive change from Baseline indicates improvement.
measure.population: Participant from the Safety Analysis Set, all participants who received at least one dose of BOTOX®, with data available at the given time-point.

reported_events.time_frame: First dose of study drug to FU last [median 21.20 months]
reported_events.desc: As per the protocol, Adverse Drug Reactions and Serious Adverse Drug Reactions were collected.

group.title: BOTOX®
group.description: BOTOX® (botulinum toxin Type A) administered according to physician prescription for the treatment of chronic migraine; all treatment decisions lie with the physician.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: There were no Primary or Secondary Outcome Measures specified in the protocol.
